document.title: Maryland Comprehensive Health Education Framework: Pre-Kindergarten Through High School

93CB17925AE54F5E845DE14E138EFE62.description:
Encourage peers to
make positive health
choices.

C2B15AEC03CC47AA88B1EBA080C31989.description:
Make requests to
promote personal
health.

3B0017843C994661A9B414F66A8ACA29.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family, and community health.

DA76E52CB88A4CF399483103E1B36A36.description:
Demonstrate behaviors
that avoid or reduce
health risks.

BAD78E08926443B38E05BDDA971E1AC4.description:
Demonstrate healthy
practices and behaviors
to maintain or improve
personal health.

ABB1BF308C804442ADD035E5FB7E494C.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce
health risks.

213C7ABA2725424BB20E66B13D40265E.description:
Identify who can help
when assistance is
needed to achieve a
personal health goal.

30D91AE184C14F37B0C792DB20044EC0.description:
Identify a short-term
personal health goal and
take action toward
achieving the goal.

AA0360493CF440B6A76138FE7D05A74F.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.

BA100FDDE4394B6399BF701EB205B60E.description:
Differentiate between
situations when a
health-related decision
can be made individually
and when assistance is
needed.

C8C86C8CDB0346529A38D802F3094BE7.description:
Identify situations when
a health-related decision
is needed.

0F76EDF9880E4A80ADF81F5F68817FC8.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.

EF60BFF4270A4BBA80ED272288F97A75.description:
Demonstrate ways to
tell a trusted adult if one
is threatened or
harmed.

765A802859C34E79B220AB648ED74417.description:
Demonstrate ways to
respond when in an
unwanted, threatening
or dangerous situation.

66000E381F2A43C69B692308AF832471.description:
Demonstrate listening
skills to enhance health.

EBA38E0F3B2540EEAE38D9607A65D80A.description:
Demonstrate healthy
ways to express needs,
wants and feelings.

F5CFD48C39834C26B72E40072DE4D2EB.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health
and avoid or reduce health risks.

CA5B44F98EC8485E89042A8418D2C752.description:
Identify ways to locate
school and community
health helpers.

F6FFA80A2CAC4BD3B8EA08618CECBD2A.description:
Identify trusted adults
and professionals who
can help promote
health.

11547EE2AE3441ABAFD7C28D1804AA06.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to access valid information, products, and services to enhance
health.

D94801A3B2BC4DBBBC9F5343C5377721.description:
Describe how the media
can influence health
behaviors.

345284D21BB04D23987F339E48AF7B52.description:
Identify what the school
can do to support
personal health
practices and behaviors.

AD397B33514B4071A44DA8E77285CFE4.description:
Identify how the family
influences personal
health practices and
behaviors.

6C43584CB6BA4BB0866893E71FDC6B30.description:
Students will analyze the influence of family, peers, culture, media, technology, and other factors on
health behaviors.

C419516319B34F8282A5B58958101FD9.description:
Identify why sleep
and rest are
important for
proper growth and
good health.

847F5D57E93A45B4870F0AF43CB41FCB.description:
Identify the proper
steps for daily
brushing and
flossing teeth.

A901595831B949C1ACC6ADF9E2B13318.description:
Identify food can
contain germs that
can cause illness.

686EF36A38764D6DB786DC5E040D8AD3.description:
Identify the steps
for proper
handwashing.

CBA579484EB347DAAB9B4EEA9D05C1D7.description:
Identify potential
food and non-food
triggers that are
common causes of
allergic reactions.

0BE939B00F374DCF870FA1E941FA7784.description:
Recognize that
eating in regular
increments helps a
person’s body.

8C4E43AF027040958EA482862ECF1B71.description:
Explain how food
affects the body.

AD519D5140D6415DA2869D97154221E3.description:
Describe body
signals that a person
is hungry and full.

7AAE7BD2492840A1B5EFEAFC40A67F8C.description:
Identify a variety of
nutritious foods and
beverages and
recognize that foods
are categorized into
groups.

52C94B90900E42A0B4E023308C65DCF1.description:
Identify the benefits
of trying new foods.

BB0B9FCC1AB74570BC156A15F10CEEE8.description:
Identify the benefits
of drinking water.

D065B785C29F44FAAF062AC080E5B125.description:
Identify parts of the
body that are
private of self or
others.

66773834D5474F178BA96DB1F85416C7.description:
Identify age-appropriate privacy
as well as setting
and respecting
healthy boundaries.

0C76397814A94319AAC623BF45BF068F.description:
Identify personal
information and
when to share it
with other people.

4CA11CAC8396470B88C51A09D23673DC.description:
Practice talking to
adults about
personal safety and
feelings.

A2C10AFE652E4C3F8220F2674A4CD381.description:
Demonstrate the
ability to seek help
from trusted adults.

91BD3A0DCDE64D74B3EDF2725E42D89A.description:
Identify how to
respond when asked
to keep an
uncomfortable
secret.

EDD98A0CAC6C47C3AF3FFAF09E27A31E.description:
Explain actions that
help one to stay safe
around strangers.

38B2D3FFEE7F4471B35F7924681BB635.description:
Identify appropriate
displays of affection
between people and
in a variety of
situations, including
physical touch and
verbal interactions.

069D91F4EBDD4E05B44B467D6F7FB3A2.description:
Identify ways to stay
safe when riding in a
vehicle or bus.

AE422D84234C4DAE98964A588A09F5A2.description:
Identify escape
routes at home and
school.

B08F7EA0F460443FAE314DFD6AE01145.description:
Identify proper
safety for activities
including biking,
skateboarding, and
riding in a car.

9B878C61256B4D4C99FB4BE0B3FA4409.description:
Explain what to do if
someone is injured
or suddenly ill and
how to call 911.

4BA990C7225949599C9021C8B2CD4508.description:
Recognize it is
important to treat
people of all gender
identities and
expressions with
dignity and respect.

79D682A866F84832ABB11CA8DC215EED.description:
Recognize a range
of ways people
identify and express
their gender.

A5F30E63975A47E8961C64568A4D1286.description:
Recognize that
individuals have
personal boundaries
and bodily
autonomy.

EEDD8CFE9C504663A550C6477E041969.description:
Recognize pro-social
behaviors (e.g.,
helping others,
being respectful of
others, cooperation,
and consideration).

0A0A776FD7CF4B819F0FC39729227C36.description:
Identify different
types of families
(e.g., single-parent,
same-gender,
intergenerational,
cohabitating,
adoptive, foster,
etc.).

F0A95887D7C9464D92F55F3F9FB2682D.description:
Identify that family
is a group of people
that support each
other.

F78D485B9220414A97A2D1E00F23F114.description:
Identify products
that can be harmful
if inhaled, absorbed,
or ingested.

E07A911B2CD846418574BB22BE4156E7.description:
Recognize that
medicine can be
harmful if used
incorrectly.

D6402937811A48DFAF736BBDF52432FC.description:
Identify school rules
about use of
medicine.

E03DF6A974F24940848E2486C1040962.description:
Identify the
importance of
talking with parents
and other trusted
adults about
emotions.

9CBA19B1084B4C1F926ED5B20D72BA88.description:
Identify the
benefits of people’s
uniqueness.

86E7CEA642ED42A0A57220DE4C9B8DFC.description:
Recognize the
feelings of another
child and how to
respond in a
healthy way.

D675F5A296274264813782CEB4086D49.description:
Demonstrate
awareness of
personal emotions
and how they may
be the same or
different from
others.

77702932108B4097AF69086993E324BA.description:
Identify big or
strong emotions
and safe and unsafe
ways of expressing
one’s emotions.

CE2F5C5F4D3A418CA646F83604895479.description:
Identify appropriate
ways to express
emotions.

3B7841FCAE85417899CD6E2B43B8003C.description:
Students will comprehend concepts related to health promotion and disease prevention to enhance
health, including:
